member.name: M:MigrationTools.DataContracts.Pipelines.Process.ShouldSerializeYamlFilename
member.summary: If the value is set, then serialize it, if it isn't don't
member.returns: bool on if the YamlFilename should be serialized.

member.name: M:MigrationTools.DataContracts.Pipelines.Process.ShouldSerializePhases
member.summary: If the type is 1 then this is a classis pipeline, so the phases should be serialized.
member.returns: bool on if the Phases should be serialized.

member.summary: reset values that cannot be set on new objects

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Enrichers.IEnricherOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Active the enricher if it true.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Enrichers.ProcessorEnricherOptions.Enabled
member.summary: If enabled this will run this migrator

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Enrichers.ProcessorEnricherOptions.RefName
member.summary: For internal use

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Enrichers.StringManipulatorEnricherOptions.MaxStringLength
member.summary: Max number of chars in a string. Applied last, and set to 1000000 by default.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Enrichers.StringManipulatorEnricherOptions.Manipulators
member.summary: List of regex based string manipulations to apply to all string fields. Each regex replacement is applied in order and can be enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Options.IOptions.RefName
member.summary: If you set a `RefName` then this configration will be added to a Catalog of configurations that can be refernced using tha `RefName` so tha tyou dont have to keep adding the ame items with the same configuration.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.ProcessorEnrichers.WorkItemProcessorEnrichers.StringManipulatorEnricher
member.summary: Used to process the String fields of a work item. This is useful for cleaning up data. It will limit fields to a max length and apply regex replacements based on what is configured. Each regex replacement is applied in order and can be enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.IProcessorOptions.SourceName
member.summary: This is the `IEndpoint` that will be used as the source of the Migration. Can be null for a write only processor.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.IProcessorOptions.TargetName
member.summary: This is the `IEndpoint` that will be used as the Target of the Migration. Can be null for a read only processor.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.IProcessorOptions.ProcessorEnrichers
member.summary: List of Enrichers that can be used to add more features to this processor. Only works with Native Processors and not legacy Processors.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.ProcessorOptions.Enabled
member.summary: If set to `true` then the processor will run. Set to `false` and the processor will not run.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.ProcessorOptions.ProcessorEnrichers
member.summary: List of Enrichers that can be used to add more features to this processor. Only works with Native Processors and not legacy Processors.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.ProcessorOptions.RefName
member.summary: `Refname` will be used in the future to allow for using named Options without the need to copy all of the options.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemTrackingProcessor
member.summary: This processor is intended, with the aid of [ProcessorEnrichers](../ProcessorEnrichers/index.md), to allow the migration of Work Items between two [Endpoints](../Endpoints/index.md).

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldClearMapConfig
member.summary: Allows you to set an already populated field to Null. This will only work with fields that support null.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldLiteralMapConfig
member.summary: Sets a field on the `target` to b a specific value.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldMergeMapConfig
member.summary: Ever wanted to merge two or three fields? This mapping will let you do just that.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldSkipMapConfig
member.summary: Allows you to skip populating an existing field. Value in target with be reset to its OriginalValue.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldtoFieldMapConfig
member.summary: Just want to map one field to another? This is the one for you.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldtoFieldMultiMapConfig
member.summary: Want to setup a bunch of field maps in a single go. Use this shortcut!

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldtoTagMapConfig
member.summary: Want to take a field and convert its value to a tag? Done...

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldValueMapConfig
member.summary: Need to map not just the field but also values? This is the default value mapper.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.FieldValuetoTagMapConfig
member.summary: Need to create a Tag based on a field value? Just create a regex match and choose how to populate the target.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.MultiValueConditionalMapConfig
member.summary: ??? If you know how to use this please send a PR :)

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.RegexFieldMapConfig
member.summary: I just need that bit of a field... need to send "2016.2" to two fields, one for year and one for release? Done.

member.name: T:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.FieldMap.TreeToTagMapConfig
member.summary: Need to clear out those nasty Area tree hierarchies? This creates Tags for each node in the Area Path...

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.IProcessorConfig.Enabled
member.summary: Active the processor if it true.

member.summary: Indicates, if this processor can be added to the list of current processors or not. Some processors are not compatible with each other.

member.summary: Migrate original team settings after their creation on target team project

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TeamMigrationConfig.FixTeamSettingsForExistingTeams
member.summary: Reset the target team settings to match the source if the team exists

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationConfig.OnlyElementsWithTag
member.summary: The tag name that is present on all elements that must be migrated. If this option isn't present this processor will migrate all.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationConfig.TestPlanQuery
member.summary: Filtering conditions to decide whether to migrate a test plan or not. When provided, this partial query is added after `Select * From TestPlan Where` when selecting test plans. Among filtering options, `AreaPath`, `PlanName` and `PlanState` are known to work. There is unfortunately no documentation regarding the available fields.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationConfig.RemoveAllLinks
member.summary: ??Not sure what this does. Check code.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationConfig.MigrationDelay
member.summary: ??Not sure what this does. Check code.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationConfig.Processor
member.summary: Indicates whether the configuration for node structure transformation should be taken from the common enricher configs. Otherwise the configuration elements below are used

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationConfig.RemoveInvalidTestSuiteLinks
member.summary: Remove Invalid Links, see https://github.com/nkdAgility/azure-devops-migration-tools/issues/178

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorConfig.WIQLQuery
member.summary: A work item query based on WIQL to select only important work items. To migrate all leave this empty. See [WIQL Query Bits](#wiql-query-bits)
member.default: AND [Microsoft.VSTS.Common.ClosedDate] = '' AND [System.WorkItemType] NOT IN ('Test Suite', 'Test Plan','Shared Steps','Shared Parameter','Feedback Request')

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorConfig.WorkItemIDs
member.summary: A list of work items to import

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorConfig.FilterWorkItemsThatAlreadyExistInTarget
member.summary: This loads all of the work items already saved to the Target and removes them from the Source work item list prior to commencing the run. While this may take some time in large data sets it reduces the time of the overall migration significantly if you need to restart.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorConfig.PauseAfterEachWorkItem
member.summary: Pause after each work item is migrated

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorConfig.WorkItemCreateRetryLimit
member.summary: **beta** If set to a number greater than 0 work items that fail to save will retry after a number of seconds equal to the retry count. This allows for periodic network glitches not to end the process.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.UpdateCreatedDate
member.summary: If this is enabled the creation process on the target project will create the items with the original creation date. (Important: The item history is always pointed to the date of the migration, it's change only the data column CreateDate, not the internal create date)

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.UpdateCreatedBy
member.summary: If this is enabled the creation process on the target project will create the items with the original creation date. (Important: The item history is always pointed to the date of the migration, it's change only the data column CreateDate, not the internal create date)

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.WIQLQuery
member.summary: A work item query based on WIQL to select only important work items. To migrate all leave this empty. See [WIQL Query Bits](#wiql-query-bits)
member.default: SELECT [System.Id] FROM WorkItems WHERE [System.TeamProject] = @TeamProject AND [[System.WorkItemType] NOT IN ('Test Suite', 'Test Plan','Shared Steps','Shared Parameter','Feedback Request') ORDER BY [System.ChangedDate] desc

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.Enabled
member.summary: If enabled then the processor will run

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.Processor
member.summary: Name used to identify this processor

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.FixHtmlAttachmentLinks
P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.WorkItemCreateRetryLimit
member.summary: **beta** If set to a number greater than 0 work items that fail to save will retry after a number of seconds equal to the retry count. This allows for periodic network glitches not to end the process.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.FilterWorkItemsThatAlreadyExistInTarget
member.summary: This loads all of the work items already saved to the Target and removes them from the Source work item list prior to commencing the run. While this may take some time in large data sets it reduces the time of the overall migration significantly if you need to restart.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.PauseAfterEachWorkItem
member.summary: Pause after each work item is migrated

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.AttachRevisionHistory
member.summary: This will create a json file with the revision history and attach it to the work item. Best used with `MaxRevisions` or `ReplayRevisions`.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.GenerateMigrationComment
member.summary: If enabled, adds a comment recording the migration

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.WorkItemIDs
member.summary: A list of work items to import

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.MaxGracefulFailures
member.summary: The maximum number of failures to tolerate before the migration fails. When set above zero, a work item migration error is logged but the migration will continue until the number of failed items reaches the configured value, after which the migration fails.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.SkipRevisionWithInvalidIterationPath
member.summary: This will skip a revision if the source iteration has not been migrated i.e. it was deleted

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemMigrationConfig.SkipRevisionWithInvalidAreaPath
member.summary: When set to true, this setting will skip a revision if the source area has not been migrated, has been deleted or is somehow invalid, etc.

member.summary: Creates a new workitemmigrationconfig with default values

member.summary: A list of work items to import

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemPostProcessingConfig.WIQLQuery
member.summary: A work item query based on WIQL to select only important work items. To migrate all leave this empty. See [WIQL Query Bits](#wiql-query-bits)
member.default: AND [Microsoft.VSTS.Common.ClosedDate] = '' AND [System.WorkItemType] NOT IN ('Test Suite', 'Test Plan','Shared Steps','Shared Parameter','Feedback Request')

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemPostProcessingConfig.FilterWorkItemsThatAlreadyExistInTarget
member.summary: This loads all of the work items already saved to the Target and removes them from the Source work item list prior to commencing the run. While this may take some time in large data sets it reduces the time of the overall migration significantly if you need to restart.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemPostProcessingConfig.PauseAfterEachWorkItem
member.summary: Pause after each work item is migrated

member.summary: **beta** If set to a number greater than 0 work items that fail to save will retry after a number of seconds equal to the retry count. This allows for periodic network glitches not to end the process.
